text: A copper cube weighs 0.25 N in air, 0.17N when completely immersed in paraffin oil and 0.15 N when completely immersed in water.The ratio of upthrust in oil to upthrust in water is
explanation: Wt. in air = 0.25 NWt.in water = 0.15 NTherefore, lost in wt. in water = Upthrust in water= 0.25 - 0.15= 0.10 N.Wt. in paraffin oil = 0.17 N... loss in wt. in oil = upthrust in the oil = 0.25 - 0.17 = 0.08Ratio of upthrust in oil to upthrust in water= \(\frac{0.08}{0.10}\) = \(\frac{8}{10}\) = \(\frac{4}{5}\) Or 4 : 5

text: A wheel and axle is used to raise a load of 500 N by the application of an effort of 250 N. If the radii of the wheel and the axle are 0.4 cm and 0.1 cm respectively, the efficiency of the machine is

The hydrostatic blood pressure difference between the head and the feet of a boy standing straight is 1.65 x 104 Nm-2. Find the height of the boy.
[ Density of blood = 1.1 x 103 kgm-3, g = 10ms-2]
explanation: [ Density of blood = 1.1 x 103 kgm-3, g = 10ms-2]Pressure = pgh, where p = density, h = the height, g = acceleration of free fall due to gravity1.6.5 x 104 = 1.1 x 103 x 10 x htherefore h = 1.65 x 104/1.1 x 103 x 10 = 1.5m

text:
A body weighing 80N stands in an elevator that is about to move. The force exerted by floor on the body as the elevator moves upward with an acceleration of 5 ms-2 is
[g = 10ms-2]
explanation:
W = Mg
man's weight = 80N then his mass = \(\frac{80}{10}\) = 8kg
T = Mg + Ma = M( g + a) = 8(10 + 5) = 8 x 15 = 120N.

text: Which of the following is a characteristics of stationary waves?

options.A: They are formed by two identical waves travelling in opposite directions
options.B: they can be transverse or longitudinal
options.C: The distance between two successive nodes is one wavelenght
options.D: The antinode is a point of minimum displacement

explanation: They are produced by the superposition of two progressive identical waves travelling in opposite directions

water is a poor thermometric liquid because it
explanation: Wet glass: Water's ability to adhere to the glass can cause inaccuracies in readings due to meniscus formation and inconsistent surface tension.

text: a ray of light which strikes a glass slab from air at normal incidence passes through the slab

options.A: undeviated and undisplaced at a lower speed
options.B: deviated and undisplaced at a lower speed
options.C: deviated and displaced at a lower speed
options.D: undeviated and displaced at a faster speed

explanation: The angle of refraction will be zero as the angle of incidence is zero in this case. This is a rule, that whenever a ray strikes perpendicularly or normally to a surface, no refraction will take place and hence the ray will pass through without deviating from its path.

text: blowing air over a liquid aids evaporation by
explanation: if you blow dry air over the glass you blow away this extra water vapor, thereby decreasing the amount of water vapor entering the glass.

text: The phenomenon that makes sound  persist when its source has been removed is known as
the pressure of 3 moles of an ideal gas at a temperature of 27°C having a volume of 10-3m3 is
Vibration in a stretched spring cannot be polarized because they are
explanation: In longitudinal waves, such as sound waves in a liquid or gas, the displacement of the particles in the oscillation is always in the direction of propagation, so these waves do not exhibit polarization.

text: The diagram above show s the force-extension curve of a piece of wire. The energy stored when the wire is stretched from E to F is?
explanation:
The energy store is equal to the work done in stretching the wire from E to F given by the \(\frac{1}{2}\)Fe
where e = 0.10 - 0.50 = 0.05m.
F = 0.2 + 0.1 = 0.3N
= \(\frac{1}{2}\) x (0.2 + 0.1) x (0.10 - 0.50) = 7.5 x 10\(^{-3}\)J

text: The diagram above shows the force (F) acting on an object through a distance (x). The work done on this object is expressed as
Calculate the refractive index of the material for the glass prism in the diagram above
explanation:
n = \(\frac{\frac{A+D}{2}}{sin\frac{A}{2}}\)
where A = the refracting angle of the prism(60º)D = angle of deviation of the ray (30°)
n = \(\frac{\frac{60+30}{2}}{sin\frac{60}{2}}\)
= \(\frac{sin45}{sin30}\)
v = \(\frac{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}}{\frac{1}{2}}\)\(\frac{\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}}{\frac{1}{2}}\)=  \(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{2}\) x \(\frac{2}{1}\) = \(\sqrt{2}\)n = \(\sqrt{2}\)

text: The electromagnetic wave that can produce a heating effect on the environment is
explanation: Infrared rays produce a high heating effect. All red-hot bodies such as a heated iron ball, flame, and fire are sources of infrared rays.

text: an electric cell with nominal voltage E has a resistance of 3Ω connected across it. If the voltage falls to 0.6E, the internal resistance of the cell is
explanation:
IR = 0.6 X I ( R + r )
I X 3 = 0.6 X I ( 3 + r )
3I / 0.6I = 3 + r
5 = 3 + r
r = 2 ohms

text:
\(^{23}_{11}\)Na + X  → \(^{20}_9\)F + \(^4_2\)He
What particle is X in the reaction above?
explanation:
The particle in the reaction is a neutron
\(^{23}_{11}\)Na + \(^1_0\)n  → \(^{20}_9\)F + \(^4_2\)He

text: Pure silicon can be converted to a p-type by adding a controlled amount of

The energy associated with the photon of a radio transmission at 3 x 105 Hz is
[h = 6.63 x 10-34Js]
The percentage of the original nuclei of the sample of a radioactive substance left after 5 half - lives is
explanation: After 5 half-lives, the fraction of any radio-active substance left = (1/2)5 = 1/32Thus the percentage of the original nuclei = 1/32/1 x 100/1assuming the original amount is unity percentage left= 1/32 x 100/1 = 3.12 = 3%

text: From the generating station to each substation power is transmitted at a very high voltage so as to reduce
explanation: Power is transmitted at very high voltages primarily to reduce heating in the coils(cables).High Voltage: Lowers current, minimizing resistive (I\(^2\)R) losses, which cause heating.Eddy Currents: While they can be a concern in certain applications, such as transformers, they are not the primary issue in high-voltage transmission.

At what frequency would a capacitor of 2.5μF used in the radio circuit have a reactance of 250Ω
A current of 0.5 A flowing 3h Deposits 2g of metal during electrolysis. The quantity of the same metal that would be deposited by the currents of 1.5A flowing in 1h is
explanation:
From Faraday's Law, mass deposited during electrolysis is given by\(M_1 = I_1t_1Z\)=> Z = \(\frac{M_1}{(I_1t_1)}\)
⇒ Z =\(\frac{2}{0.5 \times3}\) = 1.333Kg/CFor a current of 1.5A flowing for 1h, the mass M, deposited is given by\(M_2 = ZI_2T_2\) = 1.333 x 1 x 1.5 = 2.0g\(M_2\) = 2.0g
note: converting time to seconds here is not necessary.

text: Which of the following statements is true of the properties of a moving coil galvanometer?

options.A: THe coil has a small area
options.B: There are strong hair springs to gives a large control panlel
options.C: There is a strong permanent magnet to give  high magnetic flux
options.D: it has a small number of turns of coil

explanation: The galvanometer possesses a rectangular coil mounted on a soft iron core rotating on a magnetic field induced by a permanent magnet.

text:
A bead travelling on a straight line wire is brought to rest at 0.2 by friction. If the mass of the bead is 0.01kg and the coefficient of friction between the bead and the wire is 0.1, determine the work done by the friction
[g = 10ms\(^2\)]
explanation: Work done by friction = Friction force x displacement from the relation, f = μRwhere μ = coefficient of friction ; R = normal reaction=> F = μ mg (R = mg)= 0.1 x 0.01 x 10∴ work done = F x displacement= 0.1 x 0.01 x 10 x 0.2= 0.002= 2 x 10\(^{-3}\)
